info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 7:10PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NEVADA...STOREY...SOUTHERN WASHOE...DOUGLAS AND NORTHERN LYON COUNTIES AND CARSON CITY THROUGH 815 PM PDT... At 708 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Indian Hills, or near Carson City, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Very heavy rain and sudden reduction in visibility are occurring with this storms and will result in significant ponding of water on area roads. Locations impacted include... Reno, Carson City, Virginia City, Sparks, Dayton, Johnson Lane, Lockwood, Spooner Summit, Northwest Reno, Mogul, Carson City Airport, Verdi-Mogul, Caughlin Ranch, Galena, New Washoe City, Hidden Valley, Somersett, Washoe City, Verdi, and Damonte Ranch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
